709566f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 50th Street (West)
709566f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, from W. 50th to 5lst Streets. View
No. 1 is south from 5lst Street and shows the old car-
barn on the west side of this frontage. This was de-
molished. The site provides a vantage polnt for the
additional views. There the view point is respectively
southeast and north east; the station being at 50th St.
Beyond same is the future Rockefeller Center site. Under
construction is the Grand Central Building.
October 22, 1927
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUTTIONS

713471f-a.title: Manhattan: 50th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713471f-a.text:
W. EOth Sreet, east from a point to the west of Sixth
Svenue and showing units of Roclefeller City, beyond a station
of the Sixth Avenue Elevated Line. The 7O storied R.C.A.
Building is to the richt and to the left, Radio City Music
Pall. At this date subway construction is proceeding as eviden
ced by the detail shown at the corners. In February 1939 the
''E'' will be removed.
May 3, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709562f-b.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - W. 50th Street.
709562f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, at West 50th Street, showing the tracks and
the uptown station of the ''El'prior to demolition. These
photographs are taken from the downtown platform and feature
the Opposite side.
Buildings forming the background are on the east side of
this tho oughfare and extend northward. The Radio City Music
Hall is in the R.K. O. Builuing whicn occupies the 60th-51st
Street frontage. View No. 2 snows a train of woouen cars raking
its last run uptown.
March, 1939
Views: 1-2
Vm.  Hlerries
MAY BE REPRODUCED

of View 1) showing the Rockefeller Center clearance that
extends fron 48th to 5lst Streets. The photographer is

huge building site.
September 14, 1931
P. L. Sperr  Views 1,2

713485f.title: Manhattan: 50th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713485f.text:
West 50th Street, north side, east from a point midway between
Seventh and Sixth AveS., and across the latter. Shown under demolition
is the southeastern corner of the New York Railways Company plant and
barn which occupied the entire block. The low structures east of Sixth
Ave. (Elevated station thereon) have gone and today (1937),units of
Radio City stand thereon. Note the twin spires of St. Patricks Cathedral
in the background. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
March 23, 1928.
F. M. Demarest.
Cnift of Albert A. Volk Co.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
